title: Divine and Demonic Natures
introduction: Krishna describes the divine and demonic qualities in human beings, and the importance of following scriptural wisdom.

shlokas.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||
shlokas.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet
shlokas.translation: There are three gates leading to self-destruction: lust, anger, and greed. Therefore, one should abandon these three.
shlokas.modern: The trinity of self-sabotage: wanting what you don't have (lust), being mad when you don't get it (anger), and never having enough (greed). These three will absolutely wreck your life. Check any disaster in your life - guaranteed one of these three was driving. Addiction, bad relationships, financial ruin, whatever - trace it back and you'll find lust, anger, or greed. Avoid these like your life depends on it. Because it does.

shlokas.sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||
shlokas.transliteration: tasmāc chāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau | jñātvā śāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi
shlokas.translation: One should understand what is duty and what is not duty by the regulations of the scriptures. Knowing such rules, one should act so that they may gradually be elevated.
shlokas.modern: You need a moral framework. Whether it's scripture, philosophy, or values you've developed - you need principles to guide you. Without them, you'll just do whatever feels good in the moment, which usually leads to disaster. Have a code. Live by it. Doesn't mean you're rigid or close-minded. It means you have standards. Everyone needs an operating system for life.
